Title:
MOLECULAR AND MORPHO-CULTURAL CHARACTERIZATION OF
Colletotrichum spp. ASSOCIATED WITH ANTHRACNOSE ON Capsicum spp. IN THE
NORTHEAST OF BRAZIL
Keywords:
Capsicum annum, Capsicum frutescens, Colletotrichum
brevisporum, Colletotrichum siamense, Colletotrichum tropicale,
Colletotrichum truncatum
Abstract:
The anthracnose is one the major diseases of Capsicum spp.
The disease is caused by fungi from the genus Colletotrichum that causes
severe losses in the world production of these crops. The aim of this
study was to identify species of the genus Colletotrichum causing
anthracnose in bell and hot pepper in northeastern Brazil according
multi-gene phylogeny and morpho-cultural characterization. The
pathogenic strains obtained from bell and hot peppers with anthracnose
symptoms were initially identified based on the sequences of GAPDH, ACT,
CAL, β-TUB genes and ITS-rDNA region. Morpho-cultural characterization
of the identified species was obtained from mycelial growth rate and
colony coloration. Besides measurements of size and shape of conidia and
appressoria. Based on the combined datasets was identified that C.
brevisporum, C. scovillei, C. siamense, C. tropicale and C. truncatum
compose the current species complex associated with anthracnose of
Capsicum spp. in northeastern Brazil.
